poem:
Title: "Upon a Narrowboat's Journey"

Narrowboat, five years afloat,
navigating England's watery coat.
Every hamlet, every mote,
column of canal or river's throat.

An era's echo, once remote,
where every county found a boat.
The lover's heart in each note,
water's reach, a handwritten quote.

End of network comes, we dote,
on a journey, blue and bloat,
In love, on river, canal devote,
A boatman's song, in dreams we wrote.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "After five years on a narrowboat, I’ve finally reached the end of the canal network “Once upon a time, not so very many years ago, it was possible to travel all over England, north, south, east and west, by river and canal; there was not a county you could not visit, hardly a town you could not reach by water, if you liked and if you were not (and what lover of boats and rivers ever was". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
